Module it.polimi.ingsw.PSP18
Package it.polimi.ingsw.PSP18.server.controller

Class MatchSetUp

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.PSP18.server.controller.MatchSetUp
  • public class MatchSetUp
extends java.lang.Object
    class that deals with all the set up methods used before the actual match start like: checking for the players ready status and the divinities chosen,

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      MatchSetUp​(MatchSocket matchSocket, int playerN)
      Constructor of MatchSetup, initializes matchSocket and the number of players in the current match

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void divinityCreation​(SocketThread socket, java.lang.String divinity)
      Create the divinity of the player that decided which divinity to use If there are no more players that have to choose the divinity start the match If there are other players, ask the next to choose the divinity
      void divinitySelection​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> divinities)
      Method used to send the DivinityPick message which allows the last player og the lobby to pick the divinities list to choose from between the original nine
      void readyManagement​(SocketThread socket)
      Wait for all the players to be ready and then start the divinity selection phase

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MatchSetUp

        public MatchSetUp​(MatchSocket matchSocket,
                  int playerN)
        Constructor of MatchSetup, initializes matchSocket and the number of players in the current match
        Parameters:
        matchSocket - object containing all the players infos and their sockets
        playerN - number of players in the game

    • Method Detail

      • readyManagement

        public void readyManagement​(SocketThread socket)
        Wait for all the players to be ready and then start the divinity selection phase
        Parameters:
        socket - the reference to the socket

      • divinityCreation

        public void divinityCreation​(SocketThread socket,
                             java.lang.String divinity)
        Create the divinity of the player that decided which divinity to use If there are no more players that have to choose the divinity start the match If there are other players, ask the next to choose the divinity
        Parameters:
        socket - the socket reference, used to get the correct player
        divinity - string that represent the divinity to be created

      • divinitySelection

        public void divinitySelection​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> divinities)
        Method used to send the DivinityPick message which allows the last player og the lobby to pick the divinities list to choose from between the original nine
        Parameters:
        divinities - list containing the 9 divinities
